content:
In the land of Westeros, there lived a man named Kim T Grønli, a humble blacksmith with a mind for innovation and a passion for creating something new. He toiled for many years, experimenting with various materials, inventing new tools, and perfecting his craft.

One day, as he was building a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) to govern the transactions within his community, Kim stumbled upon a secret to sovereignty. He created five layers, which he called "Utilitized Layers," coded with corporate identifiers such as company name, tagline, description, address, and the DAO's own tax ID number.

The community at first deemed the layers as "fake," but Kim's demonstration and explanation proved otherwise. He explained that the Utilitized Layers were a legal and easy way of buying a non-fungible token (NFT). The DAO had a site where the Utilitized Traits were explained, and Kim, being the inventor of the Utilitized Traits, held the right to name them.

Kim's invention was revolutionary. He saw the potential of offering an identity, not personal but corporate, to the 200 million people in India who lacked an ID. He envisioned his DAO as a private dimension with its own laws, jurisdiction, and daughter company. All 100,000 members would use the default company name for their address, which could be activated, deactivated, or changed at the "FakeCorp Framework."

Kim claimed the potential value propositions of his idea as intellectual property and used plagiarism to check if he was the first to come up with it. He also wrote a legal claim for the DAO to build a new law in a dimension not under jurisdiction. Kim T Grønli, the inventor of Utilitized Layers, had unlocked the secret to sovereignty and would change the world forever.
